io.commercetools.sunrise.email

Interface EmailSender

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GmailSmtpEmailSender, SmtpAuthEmailSender
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface EmailSender
    A service for sending e-mails.

    Instances of the e-mail service are created with a configuration such that they can later send messages without requiring further credentials or configuration of servers.

    The service API is based on the Java Mail API. Note that implementations of this service might choose not to send e-mails using the (default implementation of the) Java Mail API but to merely accept messages created using the Java Mail API. You may want to consult the samples, JavaDocs and specification of the Java Mail API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<java.lang.String> send(java.util.function.Consumer<javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage> messageAuthor)
      Create a completion stage that asynchronously sends an e-mail using the configuration of this e-mail service.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        @Nonnull
java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<java.lang.String> send(@Nonnull
                                                                     java.util.function.Consumer<javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage> messageAuthor)
        Create a completion stage that asynchronously sends an e-mail using the configuration of this e-mail service. Before this method returns, the message author argument of this method is passed an empty MimeMessage that the EmailSender created. The message author shall prepare the message so it can be sent. Sending will happen asynchronously, though.

        Refer to the Java Mail JavaDoc and the Java Mail Specification on how to configure instances of MimeMessage. The following code shows a simple example. 

        
 CompletionStage<String> completionStage = emailSender.send(msg -> {
      msg.setFrom("foo@domain.com");
      msg.setSubject("Subject, "UTF-8");
      msg.setText("Text", "UTF-8");
      msg.setSentDate(new Date());
      msg.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.TO, "bar@domain.com");
 });
        The CompletionStage returned by this method may be combined with further completion stages. To directly send the email and get its message ID, obtain a completable future as in the following example. 
        
 String messageID = completionStage.toCompletableFuture().join();
        Exceptions that occur while sending the email are instances of EmailSenderException that are wrapped in an unchecked CompletionException thrown by CompletableFuture.join().

        Implementations of this method need to apply timeouts that may be configured when creating the EmailSender instance. The timeouts avoid denial of service by too many connections waiting for stalled I/O.

        Parameters:
        messageAuthor - a consumer that fills the empty message created by the email sender. Note that MimeMessage instances are not immutable. Messages passed to the consumer must only be used by that consumer instance and must not be passed elsewhere.
        Returns:
        A completion stage for sending the message asynchronously.
